* Entry point of the Songbird chatbot.
* Songbird greets the user and reads the user's command.
* This method should be called once at the start of the program.
// check for "bye" command and handle it
* Represents the Bye command that exits the program.
* Initializes the Bye command with the type, friendly name, and description.
* Prints a goodbye message to the user.
* Represents a command that the user can input.
* The command is responsible for executing the user's input.
* The command is also responsible for providing a friendly name and description to the user.
* The command is an abstract class that is inherited by specific command classes.
* Constructor for the Command class. Initializes the command with the given type, friendly name, and description.
* @param type         The type of the command.
* @param friendlyName The friendly name of the command, shown to the user.
* @param description  The description of the command, shown to the user.
public Command(CommandType type, String friendlyName, String description) {
* Represents the different types of commands that the user can input.
public static CommandType fromString(String command) throws SongbirdInvalidCommandException {
* Represents a command that adds a Deadline task to the task list.
* The DeadlineAdd command is used to add a Deadline task to the task list.
* The command requires additional input from the user, which is the description of the Deadline task to be added, as
* well as the deadline of the task.
* Constructor for the TaskAddCommand class. Initializes the command with the given task description.
* @param taskDescription The description of the task to be added.
public DeadlineAddCommand(TaskList tasks, String taskDescription, String deadline) {
super(CommandType.DEADLINE, "deadline", "Adds a new Deadline task to the task list.");
* Adds a new Deadline task to the task list and provides the user with a response.
* Represents a command that adds an Event task to the task list.
* The EventAdd command is used to add an Event task to the task list.
* The command requires additional input from the user, which is the description of the Event task to be added, as
* well as the starting and ending time of the task.
* Constructor for the TaskAddCommand class. Initializes the command with the given task description.
* @param taskDescription The description of the task to be added.
public EventAddCommand(TaskList tasks, String taskDescription, String eventStart, String eventEnd) {
super(CommandType.EVENT, "event", "Adds a new Event task to the task list.");
* Adds a new Event task to the task list and provides the user with a response.
Task addedTask = tasks.addTask(new EventTask(taskDescription, eventStart, eventEnd));
* Represents a command that lists all saved tasks.
* The List command is used to display all saved tasks to the user.
* The command does not require any additional input from the user.
* Constructor for the ListCommand class. Initializes the command with the given TaskList.
* @param tasks The TaskList to be used by the command.
* Prints the list of saved tasks to the user.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Initializes the Delete command with the type, friendly name, and description.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be deleted.
super(CommandType.DELETE, "delete", "Deletes a task from the task list.");
* Deletes the task at the specified index from the task list.
* Represents a command to mark a task as done in the task list.
* Initializes the Mark command with the type, friendly name, and description.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be marked as done.
* Marks the task at the specified index as done.
* Represents a command to mark a task as not done in the task list.
* Initializes the Unmark command with the type, friendly name, and description.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be marked as not done.
super(CommandType.UNMARK, "unmark", "Marks a task as not done.");
* Marks the task at the specified index as not done.

* Represents a command that adds a ToDo task to the task list.
* The ToDoAdd command is used to add a ToDo task to the task list.
* The command requires additional input from the user, which is the description of the ToDo task to be added.
* Constructor for the TaskAddCommand class. Initializes the command with the given task description.

super(CommandType.TODO, "todo", "Adds a new ToDo task to the task list.");

* Represents an exception that is thrown when an error occurs in the Songbird program.
* Constructor for the SongbirdException class. Initializes the exception with the given message.
* @param message The message to be displayed when the exception is thrown.
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid command is entered by the user.
* Initializes the exception with a default message.
super("That's not a valid command. Please try again.");
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a malformed command is entered by the user.
* Constructor for the SongbirdMalformedCommandException class. Initializes the exception with the given message.
* @param message The message to be displayed when the exception is thrown.
super("That command was not formatted correctly: " + message);
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a task does not exist in the TaskList.
* Initializes the exception with a default message.
super("That task couldn't be found. Please try again.");

* @return The command object that corresponds to the user input.

* Handles commands related to adding tasks.

* @param taskParameters The parameters of the task to be added.

* @throws SongbirdException If the task parameters are empty or malformed.
private Command handleTaskAddCommands(CommandType type, String taskParameters) throws SongbirdException {
throw new SongbirdMalformedCommandException("The description of a task cannot be empty.");
// Check if the deadline task has a deadline
throw new SongbirdMalformedCommandException("The deadline task must have a deadline.");
throw new SongbirdMalformedCommandException("The event task must have a start and end time.");
// extract the description, start, and end times, no matter the order

* Greets the user with the Songbird logo and a welcome message.
* This method should be called once at the start of
System.out.println("Songbird(TM) AI by VariTech Heavy Industries, (C) 3025. All rights reserved.");

* Reads the user's command from the console input.
* Responds to the user with the given messages.
* Each message is printed on a new line and prefixed with "S> ".
* Takes in a variable number of messages to respond with, which are printed in the order they are provided.
* @param messages The messages to respond with.
* Responds to the user with an error message.
* @param messages The error messages to respond with.
event Infiltrate NeuroTech facility /from 0200 hours /to 0400 hours
deadline Delete security footage /by when the guards change shift
event Black market deal /from the usual spot /to the backup location
